creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund; purchase from the collection of Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: large, "folded-over" organic form, asymmetrical design; dark brown, wood grain texture
image_copyright: © Tanaka Nobuyuki %2F Minneapolis Institute of Art
text: Tanaka Nobuyuki studied lacquer at the Tokyo University of the Arts but teaches today at Kanazawa College of Art. In the 1990s he created three-dimensional works using dry lacquer on which he intentionally left the texture of hemp cloth. During the same period, he also developed works that were polished like a mirror. More recently, he has concentrated on pure form, exploring new dimensions in the ancient medium of lacquer.
title: Form Remaining in Memory 2012
